p: m 6A modification has been linked to viral replication and gene expression. Knockdown of methyltransferases or demethylases decrease or increase HIV replication ( 27–29). However, silencing of METTL3 or FTO has the opposite effect on the replication of HCV ( 39). Due to the different replication locations of HIV and HCV, we tested the effect of methyltransferases or demethylases on EV71 replication in Vero cells. Our results showed that m 6A methyltransferases and demethylases regulate EV71 replication, which is in an agreement with the recent reports that the m 6A machinery regulates HCV, HIV and influenza virus infection ( 27–30, 39). In particular, knockdown of METTL3 down-regulated EV71 replication, which was similar to HIV. Moreover, mutation of the m 6A modification sites in the infectious clone of EV71 followed by rescuing and titration of the mutant viruses decreased replication of the mutants viruses, compared to the wild-type virus, which was consistent with the result in METTL3 knockdown.
